subject: Re: [junit] How do I submit code which I think should be added to JUnit?
msgSnippet: ... 15 patches are open today... the first one submitted on 2001-02-05, 4 months ago... ... But many valid user resquests wait days, weeks, months to be
messageBody:
> "They" *do* accept patches, especially clean code that comes with unit
> tests.

15 patches are open today... the first one submitted on 2001-02-05, 4
months ago...

> Maybe they are more conservative then say, JUnitX, or other projects but I
> think that is ok; their goal _seem_ to be more a simple and clean package
> than a feature packed one. That's the open-source way: everybody is able to
> pick what he needs.

But many valid user resquests wait days, weeks, months to be
implemented. If patches are processed more quickly, you can keep a real
cvs tree and you be able to make a nighly (or weekly) build of JUnit.
You have then the last modifications if you want them.

I have the impression that _many_ people (including myself) are _really_
willing to contribute to the project but when you don't see any response
from the code owners you're a little bit disappointed.

My 2C

-Vladimir
